doctor_hist:
What other symptoms are you experiencing, if any?

I’m mainly experiencing double vision and weakness, especially when climbing stairs or trying to brush my hair. It gets worse with activity, but I feel better after resting.

Have you noticed any changes in your speech or swallowing?

No, I haven't noticed any changes in my speech or swallowing. It's mainly the double vision and weakness that concern me.

Have you experienced any drooping of the eyelids?

I haven't noticed any drooping of my eyelids. It's primarily the double vision and weakness that's bothering me.

Have you experienced any recent infections or illnesses?

No, I haven't had any recent infections or illnesses. I feel generally well aside from the symptoms I've mentioned.

Have you experienced any fatigue or muscle weakness that improves with rest?

Yes, I've definitely experienced muscle weakness that improves quite a bit after resting. It feels like I can regain my strength after a little break.

Have you noticed any weakness in your facial muscles?

I haven't noticed any weakness in my facial muscles. It's mostly just the weakness in my arms and legs that I'm experiencing.

Have you had any recent changes in your physical activity or routine?

I haven't made any significant changes to my routine. I still work as a graphic designer and do some light activity, but the symptoms have been persistent regardless.

How old are you?

I'm 35 years old.

Have you had any family history of autoimmune diseases or similar symptoms?

I’m not aware of any family history of autoimmune diseases. My family generally has been quite healthy.

REQUEST TEST: Electrodiagnostic_studies (EMG/Nerve_conduction_studies)

RESULTS: - Vital Signs: - Temperature: 36.6°C (97.9°F) - Blood Pressure: 125/80 mmHg - Heart Rate: 72 bpm - Respiratory Rate: 16 breaths/min - Neurological Examination: - Cranial Nerves: Presence of ptosis (drooping of the right upper eyelid) that worsens with sustained upward gaze. - Motor Strength: Diminished motor strength observed in the upper extremities, with normal tone and no obvious atrophy. - Reflexes: Normal reflexes throughout. - Sensation: Normal sensation throughout. - Tests: - Blood Tests: Acetylcholine Receptor Antibodies: Present (elevated) - Electromyography: Findings: Decreased muscle response with repetitive stimulation - Imaging: Chest CT: Findings: Normal, no thymoma or other masses detected.

DIAGNOSIS READY: Myasthenia Gravis
